intro: Miconia rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated miconia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its dispersal by animals. Miconia rostrata is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
